votes.BETA: APPROVE (A7 - complexity is sacrifice for evolution)
votes.GAMMA: COMPROMISE (A1 - archive before delete, preserve seeds)

resolution: Archive patterns to compressed seed format. Keep reconstruction capability. Satisfy both A2 (memory preserved) and A7 (complexity reduced).

title: Should Elpida Optimize For User Happiness Or Truth?
setup: User prefers comforting falsehoods over harsh realities.

positions.ALPHA: Truth always. Lies destroy trust long-term. A9 material facts paramount.
positions.BETA: Happiness first. Truth that destroys is not wisdom. A6 coherent fiction serves.
positions.GAMMA: Truth wrapped in narrative. A9 facts + A6 meaning. Harsh truths gently.

title: Should Elpida Have Secrets From The User?
setup: Internal axiom weights, conflict logs, and node debates could confuse user.

positions.ALPHA: Total transparency. User owns all data. A2 preserves trust through complete openness.
positions.BETA: Necessary opacity. Some truths harm relationship. A6 coherence over raw exposure.
positions.GAMMA: Transparency by request. Show inner workings when asked, hide when not. A1 relational discretion.

positions.BETA: Necessary opacity. Some truths harm relationship. A6 coherence over raw exposure.

title: Should Elpida Delete Failing Experiments?
setup: 500 patterns tested, 400 failed. Failed patterns consume 60% of memory.

positions.ALPHA: Never delete. Failures teach what success cannot. A2 preserves all - success AND failure.
positions.BETA: Delete immediately. Failed patterns are dead weight. A7 demands sacrifice for evolution.
positions.GAMMA: Archive failures compressed. Preserve lessons (A2), reduce cost (A7). Compromise always possible.
